The NBA announced its decision on Thursday to move its 2017   Game from Charlotte because of a North Carolina law that restricts   public bathrooms on government property to those matching the biological sex indicated on the entrances.
The North Carolina law, enacted earlier this year, directs transgender people to use public toilets corresponding to the sex listed on their birth certificate.
